items.name: Phase Boots
items.description: Provides armor and mobility to stay on top of enemies or allies.

items.name: Orb of Corrosion
items.description: Early game slow and armor reduction to enhance kill potential.

items.name: Echo Sabre
items.description: Double attack synergizes perfectly with Curse of Avernus.

items.name: Blink Dagger
items.description: Essential for initiating and positioning to save allies.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Massively increases team survivability during Borrowed Time.

items.name: Assault Cuirass
items.description: Boosts team armor and attack speed, making you a formidable frontliner.

dos: Use Aphotic Shield to save allies from stuns and damage.
Act as a frontline, drawing fire to trigger your ultimate.
Dispel key debuffs from your cores with your shield.
Use Mist Coil to secure kills or deny yourself.
Be aggressive in lane with your shield and passive.
donts: Don't be afraid to take damage when your ultimate is ready.
Don't use Aphotic Shield on yourself if an ally is in greater danger.
Don't build pure damage items; your value is in utility and survivability.
Don't waste Borrowed Time; use it to turn a fight.
Don't forget you can manually activate your ultimate.
tips: Aphotic Shield has a strong dispel, removing stuns and silences.
You can deny yourself with Mist Coil if you are about to die.
Curse of Avernus applies on buildings, making you a decent pusher.
With Agh's, try to have all allies near you when you use your ultimate.
A Harpoon upgrade from Echo Sabre can be a great late-game pickup.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane by trading aggressively with Aphotic Shield. Harass the enemy carry and secure farm for your own core.
gameplan.mid: With Echo Sabre and Blink, become a major ganking threat. Initiate on isolated heroes and force teamfights where you can protect your team.
gameplan.late: Become an unkillable frontline force. Your job is to keep your cores alive with shields and your ultimate while applying pressure.

items.name: Phase Boots
items.description: Mobility and damage to help you farm and chase with your stun.

items.name: Radiance
items.description: Massively accelerates your farm and provides teamfight presence.

items.name: Blink Dagger
items.description: Allows you to initiate with a fully charged Concoction.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Ensures you can stay in fights and deal damage during Chemical Rage.

items.name: Assault Cuirass
items.description: Maximizes your physical damage and makes you tankier.

items.name: Abyssal Blade
items.description: Provides lockdown to kill elusive heroes.

dos: Prioritize farming above all else in the early game.
Stack jungle camps for yourself to clear with Acid Spray.
Communicate your item timings to your team.
Use Unstable Concoction to gank or escape.
Give Aghanim's Scepters to your allies in the late game.
donts: Don't fight without Chemical Rage available.
Don't get caught out of position while farming.
Don't let your Unstable Concoction explode on yourself.
Don't delay your core items for fighting.
Don't forget to farm bounty runes.
tips: You can start charging Unstable Concoction and then Blink onto a target.
Acid Spray reduces armor, making targets die faster to physical damage.
Greevil's Greed works on bounty runes, making them a high priority.
Once you have Radiance, you can farm two jungle camps at once with Acid Spray.
Your goal is to farm faster than anyone else in the game.

gameplan.early: Farm, farm, and farm. Your only goal is to get Radiance as fast as humanly possible. Use Acid Spray to clear creep waves and jungle stacks.
gameplan.mid: Once you have Radiance and BKB/Blink, your power spikes. Force fights with Chemical Rage and your stun. Take objectives and control the map with your massive gold lead.
gameplan.late: You should be 6-slotted far before anyone else. Use your gold advantage to give Scepters to your teammates and end the game before enemy carries can catch up.

items.name: Tranquil Boots
items.description: Mana and health regeneration to sustain you in lane.

items.name: Magic Wand
items.description: Essential burst heal and mana in a teamfight.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Makes Ice Vortex a massive magic damage amplifier and slow.

items.name: Force Staff
items.description: Good for positioning yourself and saving allies.

items.name: Shiva's Guard
items.description: Powerful AoE slow and nuke that synergizes with your spells.

items.name: Octarine Core
items.description: More spells, more impact. Reduces the cooldown of your global ultimate.

dos: Use Ice Blast globally to assist fights you can't attend.
Cast Chilling Touch on your allies before a fight begins.
Place Ice Vortex in choke points and high-traffic areas.
Communicate with your team when you are using your ultimate.
Stay in the backlines and position safely.
donts: Don't use Ice Blast for farming; it's too valuable.
Don't get caught out of position; you are very fragile.
Don't forget that Ice Blast prevents all healing.
Don't hold your ultimate for the 'perfect' shot; using it is often better.
Don't neglect vision; your global presence relies on it.
tips: Ice Blast's shatter threshold instantly kills heroes below a certain HP percentage.
You can cast the first part of Ice Blast from the fountain and then teleport to a lane.
Chilling Touch adds a significant amount of magic damage to your team's attacks.
Aghanim's Scepter turns Ice Vortex into one of the best magic resistance reduction spells.
Aghanim's Shard on this hero is one of the best in the game.

gameplan.early: Harass in lane with Chilling Touch and Cold Feet. Focus on getting levels and look for opportunities across the map to use Ice Blast.
gameplan.mid: Play with your team. Your spells are powerful in teamfights. A well-placed Ice Blast can completely turn a fight by negating healing from the enemy.
gameplan.late: You are a global threat. Position safely, provide vision, and use your ultimate to pick off low-health heroes or initiate massive teamfights. Aghanim's Scepter makes you a huge damage amplifier.

items.name: Power Treads
items.description: Attack speed and stat-switching for efficient farming.

items.name: Battle Fury
items.description: The key to your farming speed. Get this as fast as possible.

items.name: Manta Style
items.description: Allows you to farm faster, push lanes, and dispel silences.

items.name: Abyssal Blade
items.description: Gives you lockdown to kill any hero on the map.

items.name: Butterfly
items.description: Massive boost to damage, attack speed, and evasion.

items.name: Satanic
items.description: Provides survivability and a strong dispel in late-game fights.

dos: Focus on last hitting and getting your Battle Fury.
Split push lanes to create pressure and farm.
Use Blink to farm faster and more safely than any other hero.
Identify and jump on high-intelligence, low-HP heroes.
Use Mana Void on targets that have just used their spells.
donts: Don't fight with your team before you have at least Battle Fury and Manta.
Don't blink into a fight without vision.
Don't try to man-fight other carries early in the game.
Don't stop farming; always be hitting creeps.
Don't forget to tread-switch to maximize mana and HP.
tips: You can use Manta Style to dodge projectiles and remove debuffs.
Blinking into trees can be a safe way to teleport home.
Mana Break works on illusions, making you strong against illusion heroes.
Mana Void deals AoE damage, so try to hit multiple enemies.
Aghanim's Shard is a great pickup for countering specific heroes.

gameplan.early: Survive the lane. Your goal is singular: get Battle Fury. Avoid fighting and focus every ounce of your effort on farming creeps.
gameplan.mid: Once you have Battle Fury and Manta, you are a machine. Split push relentlessly. Force enemies to respond to you, creating space for your team. Only join fights you know you can win.
gameplan.late: With Abyssal Blade and other luxury items, you are one of the strongest heroes in the game. You can now initiate on key targets and end the game.

items.name: Maelstrom
items.description: Your primary farming and wave-clearing tool.

items.name: Boots of Travel
items.description: Global presence for you and your Tempest Double.

items.name: Mjolnir
items.description: Significant upgrade to your damage and farm speed.

items.name: Scythe of Vyse
items.description: Unmatched lockdown, usable by both you and your double.

items.name: Daedalus
items.description: Massive physical damage burst.

items.name: Bloodthorn
items.description: Combines silence, crit, and true strike into one slot.

dos: Use your Tempest Double to farm lanes and jungle simultaneously.
Place Spark Wraiths in key locations for vision and damage.
Use your double to safely push high ground.
Stay far back in fights, letting your double do the dangerous work.
Micro-manage your double to use items like Scythe of Vyse.
donts: Don't let your main hero get caught; if you die, the double dies.
Don't stand still; always be farming or applying pressure somewhere.
Don't forget to use Magnetic Field to protect towers or allies.
Don't use your double's Midas if you have one on your main hero (shared cooldown).
Don't neglect your main hero's farm.
tips: The Tempest Double can use all of your items and most of your spells.
You can use Boots of Travel on your double to push two lanes at once.
Magnetic Field provides 100% evasion to allies and buildings inside it.
Spark Wraiths provide a small amount of vision.
You can 'rat' the enemy base from the safety of your own fountain with a double and Boots of Travel.

gameplan.early: Focus on farming your Maelstrom and Boots of Travel. Use your double to secure runes and harass the enemy mid laner.
gameplan.mid: Become a global menace. Push out lanes with your double while your main hero farms safely. Join fights from a distance using your double's items and spells.
gameplan.late: You are a siege engine. Use your double to relentlessly chip away at enemy buildings. In teamfights, two Scythes of Vyse and two Mjolnirs can be devastating.

items.name: Phase Boots
items.description: Armor and a speed boost to get on top of enemies for Berserker's Call.

items.name: Blink Dagger
items.description: Your primary initiation tool. Non-negotiable.

items.name: Blade Mail
items.description: Punishes enemies for attacking you during Berserker's Call.

items.name: Vanguard
items.description: Excellent against physical damage lineups for cutting waves.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Ensures you can't be disabled after blinking in.

items.name: Shiva's Guard
items.description: More armor and a powerful active slow to keep enemies close.

dos: Initiate fights by blinking in and using Berserker's Call on key targets.
Cut creep waves behind the enemy tower to pressure the lane.
Use Culling Blade to execute low-HP heroes.
Stack jungle camps and clear them with Counter Helix.
Communicate your Blink timing to your team.
donts: Don't blink into five enemies alone unless your team can follow up.
Don't be afraid to use Culling Blade on a creep for the speed boost.
Don't neglect farming your Blink Dagger.
Don't try to cut waves against heroes that can easily kill you.
Don't forget that Blade Mail returns damage before reductions.
tips: Berserker's Call forces enemies to attack you, drawing aggro off your carries.
Counter Helix procs are pure chance; play the odds.
A successful Culling Blade gives a temporary speed and attack speed boost to nearby allies.
Berserker's Call pierces spell immunity.
Aghanim's Shard is a strong pickup, applying Battle Hunger to all called units.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane. Pull enemy creeps between their towers to get solo XP and farm. Harass the enemy carry and try to get an early kill. Rush Blink Dagger.
gameplan.mid: With Blink Dagger, you are the game's tempo setter. Look for pickoffs on any hero showing in a lane. Force teamfights that are advantageous for your team.
gameplan.late: Your role is to initiate and control the enemy's most dangerous core. A good Berserker's Call on a hero like Sniper or Drow Ranger can win the game.

items.name: Arcane Boots
items.description: Provides essential mana for you and your laning partner.

items.name: Glimmer Cape
items.description: Allows you to channel Fiend's Grip safely or save an ally.

items.name: Aether Lens
items.description: Increases your cast range, keeping you safe while disabling enemies.

items.name: Force Staff
items.description: Another tool for positioning and saving allies.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Makes Fiend's Grip create illusions that attack the target.

items.name: Aeon Disk
items.description: Guarantees you won't be bursted before you can use your spells.

dos: Use Fiend's Grip on the most important enemy hero in a fight.
Use Nightmare to set up kills or save an ally.
Sap the enemy's damage with Enfeeble in lane.
Communicate your Fiend's Grip target to your team.
Stay in the back and use your long cast range.
donts: Don't get caught out of position; you are a prime target.
Don't use Fiend's Grip on a target with Linken's Sphere or an ally who can break it.
Don't forget you can attack a Nightmared ally to wake them up without taking damage.
Don't expose yourself while channeling your ultimate.
Don't try to be a damage dealer; you are a pure controller.
tips: Brain Sap deals pure damage and heals you, making it great for trading.
You can Nightmare an ally to save them from a projectile or allow them to reposition.
Fiend's Grip disables a hero for a very long time, making it one of the best single-target lockdowns.
Aghanim's Shard makes Brain Sap apply to a second target, greatly increasing survivability.
Nightmare can be transferred to a nearby enemy if the initial target is attacked.

gameplan.early: Be a menace in lane. Use Enfeeble and Brain Sap to make the enemy offlaner's life miserable. Set up kills for your carry with Nightmare.
gameplan.mid: With your ultimate, any gank becomes a guaranteed kill. Play with your team, find pickoffs, and use Fiend's Grip to win teamfights.
gameplan.late: Positioning is everything. Stay far back, use Aether Lens and Glimmer Cape, and disable the enemy's most fed core. A successful ultimate on the right target wins the fight.

items.name: Boots of Travel
items.description: Global mobility to apply pressure everywhere.

items.name: Blink Dagger
items.description: Essential for getting in position to use Flaming Lasso.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Prevents you from being stunned while dragging an enemy with Lasso.

items.name: Force Staff
items.description: Allows you to drag enemies even further into your team.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Lassoes a second target, providing immense teamfight control.

items.name: Shiva's Guard
items.description: Provides armor and a strong slow to keep enemies from escaping.

dos: Stack Sticky Napalm on enemies before committing to a kill.
Use Firefly to farm jungle camps and gain flying vision.
Initiate on key, isolated targets with Flaming Lasso.
Communicate your Lasso target to your team so they can follow up.
Use your mobility to split push and create map pressure.
donts: Don't try to Lasso a target without a few stacks of Napalm on them.
Don't break your Lasso by moving too far away from the target.
Don't initiate without your team nearby to kill the Lassoed target.
Don't neglect farming your core items (Blink, BKB).
Don't forget Firefly destroys trees, which can be used to escape.
tips: Sticky Napalm's slow and turn rate reduction stack.
You can use items like Force Staff while channeling Flaming Lasso.
Firefly gives you flying movement, allowing you to move over cliffs and trees.
A successful Lasso is often a guaranteed kill.
Aghanim's Shard is very strong, giving Flamebreak a second charge and knockback.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane with Sticky Napalm. Harass the enemy constantly and build up stacks for a kill attempt with Flamebreak. Farm your Blink Dagger.
gameplan.mid: You are the primary initiator. With Blink and BKB, find a key target, Lasso them, and drag them into your team. This creates a 5v4 advantage and lets you take objectives.
gameplan.late: Your role remains the same, but targets are more dangerous. An Aghanim's Scepter can be game-winning by taking two heroes out of a fight. Focus on catching cores out of position.

items.name: Helm of the Overlord
items.description: Creates a powerful army for pushing and fighting.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Removes the cooldown on Wild Axes, providing immense damage.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Allows you to stand your ground and throw axes in fights.

items.name: Assault Cuirass
items.description: Buffs your entire army's armor and attack speed.

items.name: Blink Dagger
items.description: For better positioning to land a key Primal Roar.

items.name: Refresher Orb
items.description: Double Primal Roar and a second army can end the game.

dos: Use your Boar to scout and slow enemies.
Stack Wild Axes to quickly burst down heroes.
Use Primal Roar on a high-priority target to start a fight.
Push towers with your summoned units whenever possible.
Use your Hawk for vision over key areas like Roshan.
donts: Don't let your summons be picked off for free gold.
Don't waste Primal Roar on a support if a core is available.
Don't neglect controlling your units; they are a major part of your strength.
Don't stand in the frontline without BKB.
Don't forget your aura benefits your entire team.
tips: Wild Axes damage amplifies from all sources, not just your own.
Primal Roar is a BKB-piercing stun.
You can control the Hawk to provide vision in teamfights.
Helm of the Overlord allows you to dominate a strong neutral creep, adding to your army.
With Agh's Scepter, you can throw axes non-stop, melting heroes and buildings.

gameplan.early: Use your Boar to dominate the lane. Secure last hits and harass the enemy. Your goal is to get Helm of the Overlord and start pushing towers.
gameplan.mid: With Aghanim's Scepter, your damage output is immense. Group up with your team, use Primal Roar to get a pickoff, then take objectives with your army and axes.
gameplan.late: You are a siege monster. Your job is to enable your team to take high ground. A double Primal Roar with Refresher can completely disable the enemy team.

items.name: Power Treads
items.description: Attack speed and stats.

items.name: Maelstrom
items.description: Accelerates your farm and provides magic damage burst.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Essential for running at enemies without being disabled.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Gives you a second charge of Blood Rite, a massive teamfight spell.

items.name: Butterfly
items.description: Evasion, attack speed, and damage.

items.name: Abyssal Blade
items.description: Lockdown for heroes who might try to teleport away from Rupture.

dos: Use Thirst to identify and hunt down low-HP enemies.
Cast Rupture on mobile heroes to force them to stand still.
Use Blood Rite to silence and damage enemies in an area.
Be aggressive when enemies are low, as Thirst gives you immense speed and damage.
Use Bloodrage on yourself before a fight or on an ally who deals high damage.
donts: Don't use Rupture on a hero who doesn't need to move (like Sniper).
Don't overextend just because you see a low-HP hero across the map.
Don't forget that Bloodrage amplifies all damage, including damage you take.
Don't fight without BKB against heavy-disable lineups.
Don't be afraid to use Rupture defensively on an enemy chasing you.
tips: Thirst provides vision of low-HP heroes, even if they are invisible.
Rupture deals pure damage, ignoring armor and magic resistance.
You can cast Bloodrage on allies to amplify their spell damage.
Blood Rite's silence is very effective against spell-casters.
Aghanim's Scepter with two Blood Rite charges is devastating in teamfights.

gameplan.early: Focus on farming and controlling the lane. Use Bloodrage for easier last-hitting and denies. Once you hit level 6, look for a gank with Rupture.
gameplan.mid: With BKB, you can be a formidable teamfighter. Use Rupture on a key target and run them down. Your ability to clean up fights with Thirst is unparalleled.
gameplan.late: Become a true carry. Your job is to kill the backline. Use your speed from Thirst to weave in and out of fights, picking off vulnerable targets.

items.name: Phase Boots
items.description: Damage and mobility to chase down tracked targets.

items.name: Orb of Corrosion
items.description: Early game slow and armor reduction for ganking.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Upgrades Jinada into a powerful bouncing nuke.

items.name: Desolator
items.description: Massive damage boost to one-shot supports.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Allows you to get your damage off without being disabled.

items.name: Monkey King Bar
items.description: Deals with evasion and provides more damage.

dos: Use Track on every possible enemy hero in a fight.
Roam the map looking for ganks on vulnerable heroes.
Provide vision for your team with Track.
Use Shadow Walk to scout and position for kills.
Steal gold with Jinada from enemy heroes.
donts: Don't show yourself in lane unnecessarily; stay hidden.
Don't try to be a frontline carry; you are a skirmisher.
Don't forget that Track gives vision and bonus gold to your whole team.
Don't waste Track on a hero that is about to die anyway.
Don't walk around without mana for Shadow Walk.
tips: Track provides True Sight over the target.
Jinada's cooldown is independent of your attack speed; use it as soon as it's ready.
Aghanim's Scepter allows Jinada to hit multiple tracked enemies, which is huge in teamfights.
You can use Shuriken Toss to interrupt channeling spells.
The bonus gold from Track can give your team a massive economic advantage.

gameplan.early: Play as a roamer. Gank mid, gank the safe lane, create chaos. Your goal is to disrupt the enemy's laning stage and get your team ahead with Track gold.
gameplan.mid: With Aghanim's, you become a potent teamfighter. Stay on the edge of the fight, cast Track on everyone, and use your bouncing Jinada to deal massive damage.
gameplan.late: Your role is to provide vision with Track and burst down key support heroes. A well-placed Track can reveal an enemy carry trying to hide, winning you the game.

items.name: Phase Boots
items.description: Armor and mobility.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Your most important item. Allows you to fight inside and outside your ultimate.

items.name: Blink Dagger
items.description: Positioning to clap and split on key targets.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Allows you to get your full combo off.

items.name: Refresher Orb
items.description: Double Primal Split is one of the strongest late-game abilities.

items.name: Assault Cuirass
items.description: Makes you and your spirits tankier and hit harder.

dos: Use Primal Split to turn fights and become a huge threat.
Learn to micro your three spirits effectively.
Use Thunderous Clap to slow and damage enemies.
Use Drunken Brawler's evasion and critical strike to your advantage.
Initiate fights with Blink and your clap/split combo.
donts: Don't die before you can use Primal Split.
Don't forget to use the abilities of your spirits (Cyclone, Dispel, Stun).
Don't try to man-fight without your ultimate up.
Don't use Primal Split just to save yourself if the fight is already lost.
Don't neglect farming your Aghanim's Scepter.
tips: The Storm spirit can Cyclone a key enemy, taking them out of the fight.
The Earth spirit has a long-duration stun.
The Fire spirit deals significant damage over time.
With Aghanim's, you can cast spells and continue fighting even while split.
Aghanim's Shard is incredibly powerful, granting you a second Cinder Brew charge and making Drunken Brawler an active.

gameplan.early: Survive and farm. Your goal is Aghanim's Scepter. Use your spells to secure last hits and harass. You are not a strong laner until you get a few levels.
gameplan.mid: Once you have Agh's and Blink, you are a monster. Initiate on a key target, use Primal Split, and wreak havoc. Your ultimate is a free teamfight win if used correctly.
gameplan.late: Become the ultimate controller. A Refresher Orb allows for two Primal Splits, which is almost impossible for an enemy team to deal with. Your job is to disable and chaos.

items.name: Power Treads
items.description: Stats and attack speed.

items.name: Vanguard
items.description: Makes you incredibly tanky in the early game.

items.name: Bloodstone
items.description: Massive mana regeneration to spam your spells.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Makes Quill Spray an AoE Viscous Nasal Goo, a huge power spike.

items.name: Shiva's Guard
items.description: More armor, intelligence, and a powerful slow.

items.name: Heart of Tarrasque
items.description: Makes you nearly unkillable if the enemy lacks breaks.

dos: Spam Quill Spray to stack damage on enemies.
Always face your back towards the enemy to take less damage.
Run at enemies to apply Viscous Nasal Goo.
Be the frontline for your team, absorbing damage and spells.
Dive towers to secure kills once you are tanky.
donts: Don't face enemies head-on in fights; show them your back.
Don't be afraid to be aggressive, but know your limits.
Don't get broken by heroes with Silver Edge or other breaks.
Don't run out of mana; manage your spell casting.
Don't build pure damage items; your damage comes from spell spam.
tips: Each stack of Warpath increases your movement speed and damage.
Quill Spray damage is physical and stacks infinitely.
Viscous Nasal Goo reduces armor and slows, making targets easy to kill.
Aghanim's Scepter turns you into a walking armor-shredding machine.
Buy a Lotus Orb if the enemy has a lot of single-target spells.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane. Spam Quill Spray and run down the enemy heroes. You are one of the strongest laners in the game. Farm your Vanguard and start snowballing.
gameplan.mid: With Bloodstone and Agh's, you are a menace. You can run at the entire enemy team. Force fights, take towers, and create space for your carries.
gameplan.late: You are the unkillable frontline. Your job is to soak up as much damage and attention as possible while your team cleans up. Be wary of heroes with break mechanics.

items.name: Power Treads
items.description: Stats and attack speed for you and your spiderlings.

items.name: Orchid Malevolence
items.description: Silence to kill elusive heroes and mana regeneration.

items.name: Black King Bar
items.description: Allows you to fight without your spiders being instantly cleared by magic.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Massively increases your web count and mobility.

items.name: Assault Cuirass
items.description: Buffs your spider army and makes you tankier.

items.name: Bloodthorn
items.description: Upgrade to Orchid that adds critical strike and true strike.

dos: Take over the enemy jungle and one lane with your webs.
Push towers with your spider army.
Control your spiderlings to farm multiple camps at once.
Hunt down and kill isolated support heroes.
Use your webs to escape over cliffs and through trees.
donts: Don't pick Broodmother against heavy AoE magic damage (like Earthshaker).
Don't let your spider army get wiped out for a lot of gold.
Don't fight outside of your webs if you can avoid it.
Don't group all your spiders together.
Don't forget to micro your different spiderling groups.
tips: Spin Web gives you free pathing, health regen, and movement speed.
You can place webs in a chain to control a large portion of the map.
Insatiable Hunger gives you massive lifesteal and damage.
Aghanim's Scepter removes the web limit and increases your speed bonus.
Use different control groups for your hero and your spiders.

gameplan.early: Win your lane, hard. Create a web network, spawn spiders, and kill the enemy hero repeatedly. Take their tower and invade their jungle.
gameplan.mid: You are a map-control monster. Choke the enemy out of their own side of the map. Force rotations to deal with you, creating space for the rest of your team.
gameplan.late: Your role shifts to a semi-carry. You can still split push, but with BKB and Bloodthorn, you can also join teamfights and burst down key targets.

items.name: Phase Boots
items.description: Armor and mobility to get in position.

items.name: Blink Dagger
items.description: Essential for initiating with Hoof Stomp.

items.name: Blade Mail
items.description: Punishes enemies for focusing you after you blink in.

items.name: Heart of Tarrasque
items.description: Massive strength gain, which directly translates to damage for you.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Makes Stampede reduce damage for your team and go over cliffs.

items.name: Shiva's Guard
items.description: More armor and a strong slow for teamfights.

dos: Initiate fights with Blink into Hoof Stomp.
Use Stampede to save your team or initiate a fight from anywhere on the map.
Use Double Edge to secure kills or farm waves.
Build as much strength as possible to increase your damage.
Be the frontline and soak up damage.
donts: Don't use Stampede when your team is not ready to fight.
Don't neglect farming your Blink Dagger.
Don't be afraid to use Double Edge, even though it damages you.
Don't blink in without your team to follow up.
Don't forget Retaliate damages towers.
tips: Retaliate scales with your strength, making Heart of Tarrasque a damage item.
Stampede makes your entire team unstoppable and slows enemies they run through.
A well-timed Stampede can help your entire team escape a gank.
Double Edge's damage is based on your strength.
Aghanim's Shard is a must-buy, giving Double Edge a slow and strength bonus.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane with your high base damage and Double Edge. Harass the enemy carry and farm your Blink Dagger as quickly as possible.
gameplan.mid: You are the primary initiator. Look for opportunities to Blink-Stomp and get kills. Use Stampede to rotate your team around the map for ganks and objectives.
gameplan.late: Become an unkillable raid boss with Heart. Your job is to blink in, cause as much chaos as possible, and allow your carries to clean up.

dos: Use Chaos Bolt to stun and set up kills.
Use Reality Rift to pull enemies closer and get bonus damage.

Focus on bursting down a single target with your illusions.
Learn to 'Armlet toggle' to survive fights.
donts: Don't get caught without Phantasm ready for a fight.
Don't pick Chaos Knight against heavy AoE clear like Sven or Earthshaker.
Don't forget your illusions benefit from your stats, not +damage items.
Don't waste Reality Rift on an enemy you can't kill.
Don't let your Chaos Bolt's random duration frustrate you.
tips: Reality Rift reduces the target's armor.
Your Phantasm illusions deal 100% damage, making them the strongest in the game.
Chaos Strike is a guaranteed critical strike after a cooldown, not random.
With Agh's, you can use Phantasm on an allied carry to give them a massive damage boost.
Build strength items to make your illusions hit harder and last longer.

gameplan.early: Focus on farming your Armlet. Use your stun and pull to set up kills with your support. You have high kill potential at level 2-3.
gameplan.mid: With Armlet and Phantasm, you are a monster. Find isolated targets and burst them down. Your goal is to snowball from successful ganks.
gameplan.late: You are a powerful single-target carry. Identify the most important enemy and eliminate them from the fight with your illusion army. With Agh's, you can also be a massive force multiplier for another core.

dos: Dominate the jungle and convert powerful creeps.

Use Hand of God to save allies across the map.
Push towers with your team and your army.

Don't let your converted creeps die for free.
Don't forget to use your creeps' abilities.
Don't use Hand of God if the fight is already lost.
Don't try to be a right-clicker; you are a summoner and healer.
tips: You can send a converted creep back to base to heal it with Divine Favor.
Hand of God is a global heal that affects all allied heroes and your units.
Aghanim's Scepter lets you convert Ancient creeps, which are incredibly powerful.
Use different control groups for your different creeps.
Penitence slows the enemy and makes them take more attack damage.

gameplan.early: Take over the jungle. Get a powerful creep (like a Centaur or Hellbear) and gank a lane at level 2. Your goal is to create immense early game pressure and take towers.
gameplan.mid: Group up with your team and push. Your army and Mekansm make you a powerhouse in mid-game teamfights. Use Hand of God to turn skirmishes in your favor.
gameplan.late: You are the ultimate support. With Aghanim's, you can save anyone on your team with a strong dispel. Your job is to enable your cores and keep them alive through anything.

dos: Use Skeleton Walk to scout and position for ganks.

Don't stand and fight without an escape plan.
Don't forget to use Death Pact on a large creep before a fight for bonus HP and damage.
Don't engage into multiple heroes without BKB.
Don't ignore farming.
tips: Skeleton Walk's bonus speed is great for chasing or escaping.
Burning Barrage procs attack modifiers like Maelstrom and Desolator.
Death Pact is a strong dispel, allowing you to remove certain debuffs.
Aghanim's Shard is amazing, creating two skeletons from Skeleton Walk.
You can attack out of invisibility and immediately re-enter it with Skeleton Walk.

gameplan.early: Focus on farming your core items. Use your invisibility to stay safe and find occasional pickoffs on overextended supports.
gameplan.mid: With Orchid, you become a terrifying ganker. Find a target, silence them, and burst them down. Apply pressure to towers and force reactions from the enemy.
gameplan.late: You are a glass cannon. Your positioning is key. Stay invisible on the edge of fights, wait for the enemy to use their spells, then emerge and eliminate their backline.

Don't forget to use Battery Assault before you hook.
Don't build pure damage items; you are an initiator and disrupter.
Don't waste Rocket Flare; use it to check Roshan or high ground.

gameplan.early: Be a bully in the offlane. Use Battery Assault and Power Cogs to secure kills and make the enemy carry's life difficult.
gameplan.mid: You are the primary initiator. Find pickoffs with Hookshot across the map. Your job is to start fights by catching an enemy hero out of position.
gameplan.late: Your role is to disrupt the most important enemy hero. Hook their carry or a key spell-caster like Enigma. With Agh's, you can also play a more defensive, saving role.

dos: Use Frostbite to set up kills.
Harass with Crystal Nova in lane.
Provide vision and pull/stack camps.
Position yourself safely in the back of teamfights.

Frostbite can be used on neutral creeps to farm them easily.
A well-placed Freezing Field can win a teamfight on its own.
Aghanim's Scepter turns your ultimate into a massive teamfight control spell.
Always carry a Town Portal Scroll to join fights or escape.

gameplan.early: Dominate the lane with your spells. Your high base damage and nukes make you a strong laner. Get kills for your carry and start roaming if possible.
gameplan.mid: Play with your team. Your spells are crucial for teamfights. Find a safe spot to use Freezing Field, ideally after the enemy has used their stuns.
gameplan.late: Positioning is everything. Stay far back, use your utility items to save your cores, and look for that game-winning ultimate. One good Freezing Field can decide the match.

gameplan.mid: With Mekansm and Blink, you are a teamfight powerhouse. Look for opportunities to land a multi-hero Vacuum. Your combo can win fights on its own.
gameplan.late: You are the ultimate wombo-combo hero. A good Blink -> Vacuum -> Wall -> Refresher -> Vacuum -> Wall can single-handedly win the game against the right lineup.

gameplan.mid: Transition into a powerful teamfighter. Your ultimates can wreak havoc. With Aghanim's, you also become a significant damage dealer.
gameplan.late: You are a high-impact control and damage hero. Your positioning is paramount. A good Terrorize can split the enemy team and win you the game.

Aghanim's Shard is incredible, giving you magic immunity during Solar Guardian's flight.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane with your high sustain and damage. Use your hammer and stun combo to secure kills. Look for opportunities to use your ultimate on other lanes.
gameplan.mid: You are a global ganking machine. With Echo Sabre and BKB, you can join any fight and be a massive threat. Force objectives after successful ultimates.
gameplan.late: Transition into a durable frontline core. Your job is to initiate, absorb spells with BKB, and deal sustained damage in teamfights while healing your allies.

Don't waste mana; you need it for key saves.

gameplan.early: Be a strong lane support. Harass with Poison Touch and use Shadow Wave to trade effectively. Look for opportunities to save your core with a well-timed Shallow Grave.
gameplan.mid: Group up with your team. Your ability to sustain your team through fights with heals and saves is immense. Your cooldowns get very low, allowing for multiple spell rotations.
gameplan.late: You are the ultimate defensive support. A perfectly timed Shallow Grave on your carry can win the game. With Agh's, you can also dispel key stuns from your team.

gameplan.late: You are a formidable teamfighter and sieger. Your job is to break high ground. With Agh's, you also provide a huge amount of control.

gameplan.mid: Play with your team and look for pickoffs. Your combo can lock down and kill almost any hero. Control teamfights with well-placed ultimates.
gameplan.late: You are the ultimate counter-initiator. Wait for the enemy to commit, then punish them with your full combo. An Agh's-upgraded ultimate on their carry can win the game.

gameplan.late: You are a durable frontline carry. Your job is to initiate, soak up damage and spells, and deal consistent damage to heroes and buildings.

gameplan.late: You transition into a powerful utility hero. Your role is to control key targets, save allies, and spread your ultimate. With Agh's, you become incredibly hard to kill.

dos: Initiate fights with Blink into Echo Slam.
Use Fissure to block paths and secure kills.
Chain-stun enemies with your spells.
Stay hidden and wait for the perfect moment to jump.
Communicate your Blink timing to your team.
donts: Don't show yourself before a fight; you are most effective as a surprise.
Don't waste Echo Slam on one or two heroes (unless they are crucial).
Don't block your own teammates with Fissure.
Don't neglect farming your Blink Dagger.
Don't forget Aftershock procs after every spell.
tips: Echo Slam deals more damage the more enemies (including creeps and illusions) are nearby.
Fissure creates an impassable wall for a short duration.
Aghanim's Scepter allows you to jump around teamfights, stunning everyone.
You can use Enchant Totem and then blink to deliver the hit.
A well-placed Fissure can trap an entire team.

gameplan.early: Play as a support, looking for opportunities with Fissure. Your main goal is to secure enough farm and gold for a fast Blink Dagger.
gameplan.mid: With Blink Dagger, you are the game's ultimate initiator. Hide in the trees, wait for the enemy to group up, and land a devastating Echo Slam.
gameplan.late: You are a walking nuke. A single good Echo Slam can instantly win a teamfight. Play patiently and look for that game-changing moment.

dos: Use Astral Spirit to scout and deal damage.
Land your Echo Stomp -> Earth Splitter combo.
Position your Astral Spirit to hit as many heroes as possible.
Utilize the armor and magic resistance reduction from your passive.
Communicate your ultimate timing with your team.
donts: Don't miss your combo; it's your main contribution.
Don't forget to recall your spirit; it gives you bonus damage and speed.
Don't try to be a hard carry; you are a utility core.
Don't get caught without your spirit nearby.
Don't waste Earth Splitter.
tips: Natural Order removes all base armor and magic resistance from nearby enemies.
Astral Spirit gives you bonus damage and movement speed for each unit it hits.
You can cast Echo Stomp while the spirit is still moving.
The classic combo is Spirit -> Stomp -> Ult -> recall Spirit.
Aghanim's Scepter makes you much harder to kill during your combo.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane with the armor reduction from your aura and the damage from your spirit. You have high kill potential with a support.
gameplan.mid: You are a teamfight monster. Your combo can disable and heavily damage the entire enemy team. Play around your ultimate's cooldown.
gameplan.late: You are a powerful initiator and damage amplifier. The armor reduction from your aura makes enemy heroes melt to your carry's physical attacks.

items.name: Daedalus
items.description: Massive physical damage with Sleight of Fist.

dos: Use Sleight of Fist to harass, farm, and dodge spells.
Always keep a Fire Remnant in a safe place for escape.
Use your mobility to split push and apply pressure.
Chain your Searing Chains and Sleight of Fist for maximum effect.
Jump on vulnerable backline heroes.
donts: Don't get silenced; it's your biggest weakness.
Don't use all your Fire Remnants to engage without an escape plan.
Don't try to man-fight without Flame Guard up.
Don't be predictable with your remnant placement.
Don't forget you are invulnerable during Sleight of Fist.
tips: You can cast spells and use items during Sleight of Fist.
The classic combo is Sleight of Fist -> Searing Chains.
With Aghanim's Scepter, you can place a remnant in the fountain and zip across the map to engage, then zip back.
Flame Guard absorbs magic damage and deals damage around you.
This hero has a very high skill ceiling; practice is key.

gameplan.early: Survive the lane and get your levels. Use Flame Guard to farm and trade. Once you have your ultimate, you become much safer and can look for kills.
gameplan.mid: You are a mobile and elusive damage dealer. Split push lanes, force reactions, and join fights from unexpected angles using your remnants.
gameplan.late: You transition into a powerful teamfighter who can deal massive AoE damage from a safe distance. Your role is to wear down the enemy team and pick off key targets.

dos: Use Impetus from a long distance to deal massive damage.
Kite enemies with your movement speed from Nature's Attendants.
Use Enchant to take control of powerful jungle creeps.
Push towers with your enchanted creeps.
Position yourself at the maximum attack range in fights.
donts: Don't get too close to enemies.
Don't try to tank physical damage; you are weak to it.
Don't forget to use Nature's Attendants to heal yourself and allies.
Don't pick Enchantress against heroes with high physical burst.
Don't neglect micro-managing your enchanted creep.
tips: Impetus deals pure damage based on the distance the projectile travels.
Untouchable severely slows the attack speed of anyone who attacks you.
You can use Enchant on enemy summons (like Eidolons or Forge Spirits).
Hurricane Pike is your best friend, creating distance to amplify Impetus damage.
Aghanim's Scepter is core, allowing you to hit BKB'd targets.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane. Your high base damage and Impetus make you a huge threat. Enchant a creep to add even more pressure.
gameplan.mid: You are a powerful right-clicker. With Dragon Lance and Agh's, you can kill heroes from a very safe distance. Push towers and take control of the map.
gameplan.late: You are a glass cannon that deals immense pure damage. Your positioning is absolutely critical. Stay far back and pelt the enemy team with Impetus.

items.name: Aghanim's Scepter
items.description: Adds a continuous pull to Black Hole, making it even harder to escape.

items.name: Octarine Core

dos: Farm the jungle efficiently with Demonic Conversion.
Use Malefice to stun and interrupt.
Land a multi-hero Black Hole.
Communicate with your team when your ultimate is ready.
Push towers with your Eidolons.
donts: Don't show yourself on the map before a big fight.
Don't use Black Hole on a single hero unless absolutely necessary.
Don't get your Black Hole cancelled.
Don't neglect farming your Blink and BKB.
Don't forget to use Midnight Pulse under your Black Hole for extra damage.
tips: Black Hole pierces spell immunity.
Demonic Conversion instantly kills a creep and gives you three Eidolons.
Eidolons multiply after a certain number of attacks.
Midnight Pulse deals damage based on a percentage of max HP.
The fear of your Black Hole is often as powerful as the spell itself.

gameplan.early: Farm the jungle. Use your Eidolons to stack camps and accelerate your farm. Your goal is to get Blink Dagger as fast as possible.
gameplan.mid: With Blink and Black Hole, you are the ultimate teamfight hero. Hide, wait for the perfect opportunity, and land a massive ultimate to win the fight for your team.
gameplan.late: Your job is to land a game-winning Black Hole. With BKB and Refresher, you can single-handedly turn the tide of any game. Be patient and wait for your moment.

dos: Use Chronosphere to catch key enemy heroes.
Use Time Walk to dodge spells and heal damage.
Coordinate your Chronosphere with your teammates' abilities.
Farm efficiently between your ultimate's cooldown.
Focus on killing the targets inside your Chronosphere.
donts: Don't trap your own teammates in Chronosphere.
Don't use Chronosphere on a single support if you can get more.
Don't get caught without Time Walk available.
Don't build pure damage without attack speed.
Don't be afraid to use Chronosphere defensively to save your team.
tips: Time Walk backtracks damage taken in the last 2 seconds.
Time Lock can proc on the first hit of an attack.
You can move freely inside your Chronosphere, but no one else can (except with specific abilities).
Aghanim's Shard is amazing, allowing Time Walk to apply a stun.
Practice placing your Chronosphere so it only catches enemies.

gameplan.early: Focus on farming. Use Time Walk to stay alive. You are weak until you get your ultimate and a few items.
gameplan.mid: With your ultimate, you are a powerful ganker and teamfighter. Look for opportunities to catch key heroes and kill them inside Chronosphere.
gameplan.late: You are a hard carry with one of the best teamfight ultimates in the game. A good Chronosphere can win the game on its own. Your job is to catch and kill the enemy's most important heroes.

dos: Use Soulbind on two key enemy heroes.
Combo your spells with your allies' single-target spells.
Use Stroke of Fate to harass and clear waves.
Use Phantom's Embrace to silence and damage.
Position yourself safely in the back of fights.
donts: Don't get caught out of position; you are very fragile.
Don't waste Soulbind on targets that are far apart.
Don't forget that Ink Swell stuns and damages when it expires.
Don't try to be a right-clicker.
Don't neglect vision.
tips: Soulbind causes any single-target spell cast on one bound hero to also be cast on the other.
This works with items like Scythe of Vyse and Abyssal Blade.
You can cast Ink Swell on an initiating ally to create a powerful AoE stun.
Stroke of Fate deals more damage for each enemy it hits.
Aghanim's Scepter is very strong, creating an illusion that mimics your spell casts.

gameplan.early: Harass the enemy lane with Stroke of Fate. You have strong kill potential with your silence and an allied stunner.
gameplan.mid: You are a powerful teamfight controller. A well-placed Soulbind can completely turn a fight, especially when combo'd with a hero like Lina or Lion.
gameplan.late: You are the ultimate force multiplier. Your job is to enable your teammates to disable and kill multiple heroes at once. Position safely and land your key spells.

dos: Use Rocket Barrage to deal massive damage to isolated targets.
Farm stacks of creeps with Flak Cannon.
Use Call Down to slow and damage a large area in teamfights.
Use Homing Missile for vision and to force enemies out of position.
Fight with your team during your power spikes.
donts: Don't get too close with Rocket Barrage against multiple heroes.
Don't waste Flak Cannon on a single creep.
Don't get caught without BKB in a teamfight.
Don't neglect farming; you are an item-dependent carry.
Don't forget Homing Missile can be easily destroyed.
tips: Flak Cannon hits all enemies in a large radius, including invisible units.
Rocket Barrage is most effective against a single target.
Call Down applies two separate slows and damage instances.
Aghanim's Scepter is a huge damage increase and allows you to attack while stunned.
You can build either for magic damage (with Maelstrom) or physical damage (with Daedalus).

gameplan.early: You are a strong laner with high kill potential. Use Rocket Barrage and your spells to dominate the lane. Farm efficiently towards your core items.
gameplan.mid: With BKB and Agh's, you are a teamfight monster. Your AoE damage is immense. Group up with your team and take objectives.
gameplan.late: You are a powerful teamfight carry. Your job is to stay alive and dish out as much AoE damage as possible with Flak Cannon and your ultimate.

dos: Use Bushwhack to stun enemies near trees.
Use Acorn Shot to set up your stun.
Use Sharpshooter to snipe heroes from a long distance.
Play around trees to maximize your effectiveness.
Use Scurry to dodge attacks and move through trees.
donts: Don't fight in open areas with no trees.
Don't miss your Sharpshooter.
Don't get caught out of position; you are very fragile.
Don't forget Scurry gives you phased movement.
Don't neglect farming.
tips: The combo is Acorn Shot -> Bushwhack for a guaranteed stun.
Sharpshooter deals more damage the longer you charge it.
You can move while charging Sharpshooter.
Scurry has a passive chance to evade physical attacks when you are near trees.
Aghanim's Scepter turns you into a one-shot machine.

gameplan.early: Harass the enemy with Acorn Shot. Look for kill opportunities with your stun combo near trees. Farm your Maelstrom.
gameplan.mid: You are a powerful ganker and damage dealer. With Agh's, you can pick off almost any hero on the map. Play from the trees and control vision.
gameplan.late: You are a glass cannon sniper. Your job is to stay in the back, land your stuns, and one-shot a key target with your ultimate.

dos: Dominate your lane with Burning Spears.
Use Life Break to initiate on key targets.
Toggle your Armlet to stay alive at low HP.
Play aggressively when you have the advantage.
Take Roshan early with your high damage and sustain.
donts: Don't pick Huskar against heavy pure damage or breaks (like AA or Viper).
Don't jump in without knowing where the rest of the enemy team is.
Don't forget to use Inner Fire to disarm and push enemies away.
Don't fight without Armlet.
Don't be afraid to be at low health; that's where you are strongest.
tips: Berserker's Blood gives you massive attack speed and health regen at low HP.
Burning Spears deal magic damage over time and stack.
Life Break slows the target and deals a percentage of their current HP as damage.
Armlet toggling is a crucial skill to master on this hero.
Aghanim's Scepter turns your ultimate into a BKB-piercing taunt.

gameplan.early: Win your lane, hard. Spam Burning Spears on the enemy hero and force them out of lane. Get Armlet and start taking over the map.
gameplan.mid: You are the game's tempo setter. Your goal is to snowball. Take Roshan, take towers, and force fights. You are incredibly strong in the mid-game.
gameplan.late: Your power falls off. You need to end the game during your mid-game peak. If the game goes late, you need BKB and other luxury items to stay relevant.

dos: Practice your spell combinations.
Invoke the spells you need before a fight starts.
Adapt your build (Quas/Wex vs Quas/Exort) to the game.
Use Alacrity on your carry or yourself to push towers.
Use Sunstrike globally to secure kills.
donts: Don't get caught without the right spells invoked.
Don't panic and misclick your spells.
Don't neglect farming; you are very level-dependent.
Don't try to be a right-clicker without an Exort build.
Don't stand in the frontline.
tips: Quas provides health regen, Wex provides move/attack speed, Exort provides damage.
The Tornado -> EMP -> Cold Snap combo is standard for Quas/Wex.
The Tornado -> Meteor -> Deafening Blast combo is standard for Quas/Exort.
Ghost Walk is your primary escape tool.
This hero has the highest skill ceiling in the game. Practice is mandatory.

gameplan.early: Focus on getting levels. Your power is directly tied to the levels in your orbs and ultimate. Farm safely and use Sunstrike to help other lanes.
gameplan.mid: Depending on your build, you either become a ganking machine (Q/W) or a massive teamfight damage dealer (Q/E). Play around your spell cooldowns and control the tempo.
gameplan.late: You are a master of wizardry. With items like Scythe and Refresher, you can single-handedly control and win a teamfight with a dizzying array of spells.

dos: Tether to an ally and stay with them.
Use Relocate to save allies or gank enemies across the map.
Use your heals and buffs to keep your tethered partner alive.
Position your Spirits to scout and deal damage.
Communicate your Relocate plans to your team.
donts: Don't get caught alone; you are useless without an ally.
Don't break your Tether by moving too far away.
Don't Relocate into a 5-man enemy team.
Don't forget to click 'return' on your Relocate.
Don't try to be a damage dealer (unless going for a meme build).
tips: Tether gives both you and your ally bonus movement speed and shares your regeneration.
Overcharge drains your HP/Mana to give your tethered ally massive damage reduction and attack speed.
Relocate has a delay, so plan accordingly.
Aghanim's Shard is amazing, causing Tether to stun enemies it passes through.
You are the ultimate force multiplier for a single core.

gameplan.early: Babysit your carry. Keep them healed, provide them with attack speed, and set up kills with your stun.
gameplan.mid: With Relocate, you and your partner become a global ganking threat. Look for pickoffs on any isolated hero.
gameplan.late: Your job is to make your carry unkillable. With items like Greaves and Locket, you can sustain them through almost anything. An Agh's Scepter turns your entire team into a juggernaut.

dos: Use your spells to control teamfights and push lanes.
Land a good Ice Path to disable multiple enemies.
Use Macropyre to zone enemies or deal massive damage in choke points.
Harass with Dual Breath in lane.
Push towers with Liquid Fire.
donts: Don't get caught out of position.
Don't waste your ultimate on open ground.
Don't stack your stun with other stuns.
Don't try to be a right-clicker.
Don't neglect vision.
tips: Ice Path has a delay, so you need to lead your targets.
You can use Eul's Scepter on an enemy to guarantee your Ice Path lands.
Liquid Fire is a great tool for harassing and pushing towers, as it doesn't draw creep aggro.
Macropyre is extremely effective in narrow areas.
Aghanim's Scepter turns your ultimate into a top-tier teamfight spell.

gameplan.early: Be a strong lane support. Harass with your spells and push the tower with Liquid Fire. You have good kill potential with Ice Path.
gameplan.mid: You are a powerful teamfighter. Your combination of stuns, slows, and AoE damage is immense. Play with your team and take objectives.
gameplan.late: Your role is to control space. A well-placed Macropyre can split a teamfight or melt heroes who are locked down. Position safely and spam your powerful spells.

dos: Use Blade Fury for magic immunity and early game damage.
Use Omnislash on isolated, key targets.
Place your Healing Ward in a safe place during fights.
Farm efficiently with your high base damage and Maelstrom.
Push towers after a successful fight.
donts: Don't waste Omnislash on a group of creeps.
Don't get caught without mana for Blade Fury.
Don't place your Healing Ward in the middle of the fight.
Don't try to man-fight without an item advantage.
Don't forget you can use items during Blade Fury.
tips: You are magic immune during Blade Fury, but you can still be physically attacked.
You can use Town Portal Scrolls during Blade Fury for a safe escape.
Omnislash deals more damage if there is only one target nearby.
Aghanim's Scepter gives you a mini-Omnislash with Swiftslash, a huge damage boost.
Manta Style can dispel silences that prevent you from using Blade Fury or Omnislash.

gameplan.early: You are a strong laner. Use Blade Fury to secure kills or escape ganks. Focus on farming your core items.
gameplan.mid: With your ultimate and a few items, you become a powerful ganker. Look for pickoffs on isolated heroes. Your Healing Ward allows you to take Roshan and objectives easily.
gameplan.late: You are a well-rounded hard carry. Your job is to deal consistent physical damage and use Omnislash to eliminate a key enemy hero from the fight.

dos: Use Illuminate to push lanes and deal massive damage from a safe distance.
Use Chakra Magic on your allies to restore their mana.
Use Blinding Light to push enemies away and make them miss attacks.
Use Spirit Form to gain powerful new abilities.
Position yourself safely in the back of fights.
donts: Don't get caught while channeling Illuminate.
Don't stand in the frontline.
Don't forget Chakra Magic also reduces the cooldown of the target's last used spell.
Don't waste your ultimate.
Don't neglect vision.
tips: You can charge Illuminate and then release it in a different direction.
In Spirit Form, Illuminate can be channeled by a separate spirit, allowing you to move freely.
Chakra Magic is one of the best mana-sustain spells in the game.
Will-O-Wisp (Agh's ultimate) continuously stuns enemies in a large area.
Recall allows you to teleport an ally to your location.

gameplan.early: Play as a support, constantly pushing the lane with Illuminate. Provide mana for your laning partner and look for opportunities to gank with your team.
gameplan.mid: You are a powerful teamfighter and pusher. An Agh's-upgraded ultimate can control a huge area. Depush dangerous lanes safely with Illuminate.
gameplan.late: You are the ultimate utility support. Your job is to enable your team with mana, heals, and powerful crowd control. A well-placed Will-O-Wisp can win a fight.

Use Tidebringer to cleave down creep waves and heroes.
Use Ghostship to initiate or provide damage reduction for your team.
Position yourself to hit multiple heroes with Tidebringer.
Communicate your combo with your team.
donts: Don't miss your combo.
Don't use X-Marks-the-Spot on an enemy with BKB or Manta.
Don't stand in the frontline without BKB.
Don't forget to time the return on X-Marks-the-Spot.
Don't buy Divine Rapier if you are not confident you can stay alive.
tips: You can X-mark yourself or an ally, then have them teleport to base to heal, and then return them to the fight.
Tidebringer is a guaranteed cleave attack every few seconds.
Ghostship gives a buff to any ally it passes through.
Practice the timing of your combo in demo mode.
With enough damage, a single Tidebringer crit can wipe out the enemy's support heroes.

gameplan.early: Focus on farming. Use Tidebringer to secure last hits and harass. You have high kill potential with your combo once you hit level 6.
gameplan.mid: With a few damage items, you become a terrifying burst damage hero. Look for pickoffs with your combo. A single good cleave can change a teamfight.
gameplan.late: You are a walking nuke. Your job is to position yourself to land a devastating Tidebringer crit on the enemy backline. One hit can win the game.

gameplan.mid: You are the primary initiator. With Blink and Blade Mail, find an isolated target, Duel them, and get your team to help you secure the kill. Snowball from there.
gameplan.late: Your job is to eliminate a key enemy hero from the fight. A successful Duel on the enemy carry can win the game. You become a formidable right-clicker with enough Duel damage.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane with your powerful nukes. Farm your Bloodstone as quickly as possible. You have high kill potential.
gameplan.mid: With Bloodstone and BKB, you are a walking death machine. Group up with your team, turn on your ultimate, and run down towers and heroes.
gameplan.late: You are a sustained magic damage powerhouse. Your job is to be in the middle of fights, dealing massive AoE damage. You scale incredibly well with items.

gameplan.late: Your role is to land a game-winning ultimate. With Aghanim's, you can completely lock down and destroy an enemy team that is clumped together.

gameplan.late: You are a formidable right-clicker. Your job is to get on top of a key target, pop Rage, and kill them. You excel at killing high-HP heroes.

gameplan.early: Dominate your lane with your long range and powerful nukes. Focus on farming and getting your core items.
gameplan.mid: You are a glass cannon damage dealer. With BKB, you can stand your ground and melt heroes with your incredible attack speed. Take objectives quickly.
gameplan.late: You are a powerful right-click carry. Your job is to stay alive and deal massive sustained damage from the backline. One stun can lead to a solo kill on almost any hero.

gameplan.late: You are a walking lockdown machine. Your job is to blink in, disable a key enemy hero, and hopefully take them out of the fight with your team's help. An Agh's-upgraded Finger can be devastating.

gameplan.late: You are a unique hard carry. Your bear is your main source of damage. Your job is to keep your main hero safe while your bear wreaks havoc on the enemy team.

gameplan.late: You are a hard carry that excels at teamfighting and base-sieging. Your job is to stay alive and let your glaives and ultimate do the work.
